main event: On December 11, 1957, at the Continental Divide AFS in New Mexico, military personnel witnessed unidentified flying objects (UFOs) exhibiting unusual behavior.
interesting points: The objects were oblong, the size of a pencil eraser, and had a distinctive ash color, flying at speeds less than 1000 mph.
Some of the sightings resembled falling stars but then reversed their course and proceeded in level flight.
The UFOs appeared approximately 30 degrees above the horizon, moving from north to south, and disappeared suddenly like a light being switched off.
The observation lasted from 3 to 5 seconds and included numerous military observers who did not believe the objects were meteors despite a prominent meteor shower that year.
The sightings were well-defined, with no formation, no appendages, and no radiating light from the edges of the objects.
sighted object: Unidentified flying objects (UFOs) exhibiting unusual behavior
witnesses: Military personnel from the 769th ACWRON and 759th ACAW Squadron
